Step 5: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying a 3D rotation using the euler angles and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal to create a 3D solid. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0034 units and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0 units. Step 7: Determine the shape of the part The resulting shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face of the prism is angled slightly to the right. The prism is the only object in the image with a length of 0.6136 units, a width of 0.6136 units, and a height of 0.0034 units.</description>

Then, create loop 2 also on the same face, using another circle centered at (0.6, 0.6) with a radius of 0.078. **Extruding the Sketch:** Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.18 units, and in the opposite direction by 0 units. Apply a sketch scale of 0.75. This will create a new solid body. The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.18 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1822, 0.0, 0.0] For the sketch, create a rectangle on face 1 of the coordinate system with the following line segments in loop 1: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.3696, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.3696, 0.0] and ending at [0.3696, 0.75] * Line 3: Starting at [0.3696, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Then, extrude the sketch in the normal direction with a depth of 0.0054 units and an opposing normal depth of 0 units. This is a "New Body Feature Operation". Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a tapered top. Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5048, 0.0054] For the sketch, create a rectangle on face 1 of the coordinate system with the following line segments in loop 1: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.0082, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.0082, 0.0] and ending at [0.0082, 0.019] * Line 3: Starting at [0.0082, 0.019] and ending at [0.0, 0.019] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.019] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.019. Then, extrude the sketch in the normal direction with a depth of 0.1957 units and an opposing normal depth of 0 units. This is a "New Body Feature Operation". The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, with approximate dimensions of 3:2:1. The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and the second part is a rectangular prism with a tapered top. Note that the length, width, and height of each intermediate part and the final shape are provided in the given JSON. I have constructed the instructions without any additional assumptions and in the context of the final shape determined from the JSON. The boolean operation of each part with the previous part is described in natural language rather than using specific boolean operation terms.</description>
